message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with semantic instance segmentation, which is a computer vision task, hence it is likely to belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) category. The paper proposes a loss function that encourages the network to produce a representation of the image that can easily be clustered into instances, which is a machine learning task, hence it is also likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) category. The paper also mentions that their approach is distinct from recent efforts in instance segmentation, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) category. The paper deals with semantic segmentation, which involves understanding the meaning of the image, hence it could also belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) category. Finally, the paper mentions that they achieve competitive performance on benchmarks, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.MM (Multimedia) category.
